task.title: Boilerplates: Custom Modules Settings and Steps

strow.stentry: If checked, the user can add new entries using the inline editor. Otherwise, the user can only read the journal entries.
If checked, the user can add new entries using the inline editor. Otherwise, the user can only read the activity entries.

If checked:
The paperclip icon is displayed in the inline editor, so that users can attach files to their entries.
Existing entries that include attachments are displayed in the list.
When possible, a preview of the attachment is displayed.

If checked:
The photo icon is displayed in the inline editor, so that users can use a photo as their entry.
Existing photo entries are displayed in the list.
The photo is resized and compressed for improved performance.
If checked, attached photos would be resized proportionately as the page size changes.
The maximum number of attachments per entry
If checked, the user is allowed to filter the list based on activity type.
If checked, entries of the same type are represented on the list as a single entry.
The maximum number of single-byte characters in the text entry. The actual number of characters might be fewer with multi-byte characters.

stentry.p: Content types that are displayed in the list of entries. Old content of a disabled type still remain in the database, and new content of a disabled type can still be created without error; however, they are not displayed in the list until the type is enabled again.

strow.stentry: (In the Activity Stream Filter module settings.) Content types that are included in the Filter by activity dropdown list.
The HTML template used to display the first and every other (odd-numbered) item in the directory.
The HTML template used to display the second and every other (even-numbered) item in the directory. Leave this blank to use the Item Template for all members.
If checked, the member details are displayed in a pop-up window when the user hovers over the member's listing.
The HTML template used to display a member's details in a pop-up window.

ul.li: User. Displays the profile of the current user.
Group. Displays only the members of the selected group. Module Settings — Member Directory — Filter by Group
Relationship. Displays only the members with the selected relationship to the current user. (Friends or Followers) Module Settings — Member Directory — Filter by Relationship
Profile Property. Displays only the members who have the specified value for the selected property. Module Settings — Member Directory — Filter by Property

strow.stentry: Sorts the list based on the selected field.
Sorts the list in ascending or descending order.

stentry.p: If checked, hosts are excluded from the resulting list.
stentry.note: Checking this option is useful for security. By hiding users with maximum permissions, you reduce the risk of hackers targeting those accounts or leveraging the names of those users in social engineering attacks.

ul.li: Simple Search. Provides a basic case-insensitive search of the Display Name field only.

Simple and Advanced Search. Provides both the basic search and the advanced search. The Advanced Search allows you to narrow the search results by performing a case-insensitive Boolean-AND search on the specified Search Fields.

strow.stentry: The fields to be used in the Advanced Search.
If checked, only the first page of the results is displayed and the Load more button is hidden.
If checked, displays only the groups that the current user belongs to.
The role group that is displayed by default.

The mode for the current module instance.
List. Choose this setting for the page that lists the groups.
View. Choose this setting for the page that displays the details of the selected group.
The page that displays the details of the selected group. In the target page, the Social Groups module instance must be configured with Module View Mode set to View.

The custom HTML template used to display the group list or details. You can use the following tokens in the template:
[groupitem:GroupName]
[groupitem:GroupDescription]
[groupitem:PhotoURL]
[groupviewurl]
If checked, provides case-insensitive search by group name.
If checked, a user with Moderators permissions or an administrator must approve new groups.

The mode for the current module instance.
Normal. If selected, the contents of the module are available to all registered users of the site.
Group. If selected, the contents of the module are restricted to group members.

The mode for the current module instance.
List. If selected, the items are displayed in a list.
Calendar. If selected, a calendar for the month is displayed.

The mode for the current module instance.
Normal. If selected, the contents of the module are available to all registered users of the site.
Group. If selected, the blog and all entries is associated with a group.
If checked, bloggers can use Windows Live Writer (or other remote blogging tools that use the MetaWeblog API) to post and edit blog posts.

stentry.uicontrol: Use Excerpt in Windows Live Writer

strow.stentry: If checked, bloggers can use the Excerpt in Windows Live Writer to create a summary of the post in plain text.

Entries can be individually set to allow or disallow comments.
None. If selected, comments are disabled.
Default. If selected, the default comment settings for the site are used.
Inline Login/Registration. If selected, a login/registration link is displayed in the module for unauthenticated (anonymous) users who try to leave a comment.
If checked, the blogger is required to include a summary when posting a blog entry.

The maximum number of single-byte characters for the entry's summary. Enter "0" for unlimited characters. If Enforce Entry Summary Limit is unchecked, this limit applies to automatically generated summaries only.
If checked, Limit Auto-Generated Entry Summary to applies to both automatically generated summaries and blogger-generated summaries.
If checked, the summary is displayed at the top of each entry, when entries are listed.
If checked, the blogger can format their entry summary in HTML.
The template to use when displaying the blog entries in a list.
The template to use when displaying the details of a single blog entry.

ul.li: Thumbnail. Displays the thumbnail logos of the groups in a grid.
List. Displays the list of group names.

strow.stentry: Filters the list to show only the groups in the selected role group.
The maximum number of votes that a user can give to a single idea. The votes can be given at different times, but the cumulative number cannot exceed this value.

The total number of votes that a single user can distribute among any number of ideas within the current module. While voting is enabled, votes can be changed, and revoked votes return to the user's voting pool.
If checked, registered users can submit their own ideas. If you are performing a survey, uncheck this option.

If checked, voting is allowed. You can allow users to preview ideas before voting by keeping this box unchecked, then you can check this box when voting begins. To end the voting period, uncheck this box again.
If checked, users adding new ideas would be required to choose a category from the selected vocabulary.

A node in a vocabulary tree to use as the root node. The vocabulary must already be defined in the site's taxonomy. The Manage Vocabularies link takes you to the Taxonomy Manager so you can create or update vocabularies. The Refresh link updates the Root Vocabulary dropdown box.
The time period when the rankings would be based. Example: If you choose Last Week, the rankings would be based on points earned by users in the past seven days only.
If checked, allows users to search for members by name in the displayed list.

Displays relevant buttons that can be used by the user to further filter what is displayed.
Everyone. Displays all the results.
Friends. Displays only the current user's friends who are included in the results.
Members. Displays only the members of the group specified in Membership in Group.

ul.li: All Users. Ranks and returns all registered users of the site.
Friends. Ranks and returns only the friends of the current user.
Members. Ranks and returns only members of the specified group.

strow.stentry: The group whose members to display. This field appears only if Display Mode is Members. If the selected group is None, all registered users will be included.

ul.li: Relative Ranking. Displays users in order of ranking.
Top Contributors. Displays only the users with the highest points.

strow.stentry: Template to use for the leaderboard. Some predefined templates are provided by DNN. If you choose Custom, the next four fields are displayed to allow you to enter custom HTML to be used with the current module instance only.
Available only if Template is set to Custom.
Available only if Template is set to Custom.
Available only if Template is set to Custom.
Available only if Template is set to Custom.
The information type(s) that should be displayed by this module.
The starting color of the gradient used in the Profile Completion graphic.
The ending color of the gradient used in the Profile Completion graphic.
Sorts the list based on the selected column.

stentry.uicontrol: Filter Related Items on Taxonomy Tag

strow.stentry: Returns only the related items that have the specified tag. The tag must be defined in a Taxonomy directory.

stentry.uicontrol: Filter Related Items on Content Type

strow.stentry: Returns only the related items that are of the selected content type.
The map provider to use if the event includes a reference to a location. If None is selected, a map is not included in the event details.
If checked, the word "Share" is displayed.
If checked, users can share in Google Plus.
If checked, users can share in Twitter.
If checked, users can share in LinkedIn.
If checked, users can share in Facebook.
If checked, users can share in Pinterest.
If checked, Facebook's Like button is also displayed.
If the page link is included in the share message, the selected service is used to shorten the link.
If checked, users can comment on individual wiki articles.

The mode for the current module instance.
Normal. If selected, the module displays the child pages of the current page.
Profile. If selected, the module displays the child pages of the current user's profile information.
Group. If selected, the module displays the child pages of the group page.
Who can see each specified page.
The page whose children to display.
If checked, the parent is also included in the tree/list of its children.

The initial configuration of the module's contents.
Simple View
Detailed View
If checked, the user can toggle between the Simple View and the Detailed View.
If checked, displays a detailed description when the user hovers over each icon.
If checked, displays the child pages immediately after their respective parent pages. Otherwise, all pages are displayed alphabetically in a flat list.
If checked, the tree/list includes hidden pages.

The maximum width (in pixels) of the icons to reduce the width of the module. If blank, the icons can expand horizontally based on the window size. Example: You can enter 400 to simulate a grid with two columns of icons.
If checked, tokens in the HTML text are replaced. If checked, inline editing and module caching are also disabled.

stentry.uicontrol: Max Length of Description in Search

strow.stentry: The maximum number of single-byte characters from the text that are displayed in site search results.
If checked, the HTML controls in the module's contents are decorated to match the style in other instances of the HTML module in the site.
The predefined workflow to use for content creation using this module. Workflows are defined by content managers or administrators in the Workflow Management module.

ul.li: Module. The selected workflow is used only for the current instance of the module.
Page. The selected workflow is used for all HTML module instances in the same page.
Site. The selected workflow is used for all HTML module instances in the entire site.

strow.stentry:
Where the results would be displayed:
On Same Page
Open New Page
The content types that would be included in the results.
If checked, users can enter partial words as search terms. Example, "org" will return "organization" and "organize". If too many searches take too long, uncheck this option.
The number of tags to display in each result page.
The number of authors to display in each result page.
Content added to this module can be shared in the selected social media site(s).
If checked, the Edit Profile button is displayed.

stentry.p: The custom HTML template used to display the user profile.
stentry.note: Load Default inserts HTML code wrapped inside a <div> tag. You can customize that code according to your needs.

strow.stentry: If checked, ...
If checked, ...

sectiondiv.p:
This module distinguishes between:
entries that are of type Photos, and
entries that have photo/image attachments.
If the type Photos is checked, photo entries are displayed. If unchecked, photo entries are hidden.
If either Enable File Attachments or Enable Photo Attachments is checked, entries with photo/image attachments are displayed. If both are unchecked, entries with photo/image attachments are hidden.
sectiondiv.note: If Enable Photo Attachments is checked, be sure to also check the type Photos. Otherwise, a user could create an entry with an attached photo, but they would not know that it was actually created, because they cannot see it.
sectiondiv.p: A photo entry cannot have a file attachment. However, an entry with a photo attachment can have additional attachments.

p.ph: Companion modules are displayed automatically when the main module is added to a page and are configured separately.

section.p:
To display/hide companion module(s),
From the main module's action menu, go to Edit (pencil icon) Add Companion Modules.... Edit (pencil icon) action menu > Add Companion Modules...
Check/Uncheck the Visible on Page box for the companion module that you want to be displayed/hidden.

p.ph: The number of items to display.
The number of items to display in each result page.
The number of items to initially display, and the number of additional items to display when the Get More button is clicked/tapped.
The number of items to initially display, and the number of additional items to display when the View More button is clicked/tapped.
The custom HTML template used as the prefix to the list. Typically the starting tags for the table or list.
The custom HTML template used to display each item in the list. Typically an entire row of the table or a bullet in the list.
The custom HTML template used to display the selected item in the list. Typically an entire row of the table or a bullet in the list.
The custom HTML template used as the suffix to the list. Typically the terminating tags for the table or list.
